name: Elliott House Inn

reviews.text: Matthew the nite time manger was awesome when we were there and when we were not. My wife left her shoes in the room and Matthew kept up with them until we returned 6 weeks later. The location is perfect and the rooms newly renovated. And the courtyard is beautiful. What's not to love??
reviews.title: Wonderful and most pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very satisfied
reviews.title: Great trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This a is gem in the heart of Charleston close to all main streets & restaurants. Parking available in car park opposite for $20 a night. B & B only breakfast choice is good you can have this in courtyard or rooms. Free wine & cheese every evening included. Lovely comfy four poster beds and very clean rooms. There is a hot tub also available in courtyard.
reviews.title: You could do better

reviews.text: Positives are the location and cleanliness. Negatives --are shower only warm, not enough light to read in room, very NOISY, bad smell in room, room clock was not working--needed a battery but the staff did not even have ant batteries, parking fees across the street $20 a day but if you leave and return its can be $40, some staff not at all helpful but some was good. We have stayed in other Charleston B and Bs that we're delightful and much better value with a fabulous breakfast, helpful staff and wonderful rooms and baths. Try somewhere else!
reviews.title: A Sweet Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Elliot House Inn delivers on what's needed for a nice Charleston getaway- it's clean, well-kept, and offers a superb location (it's right in the heart of Historic Charleston which makes walking to local attractions a breeze). Our room was average-sized and clean, with a comfy bed, tv, and small (but modern) bathroom. It definitely served its purpose. Be aware, however, that the Inn was originally constructed in the 1860s and may shows its age in some spots (like all historic and old buildings will). The Inn underwent renovations in 2011 and is welcoming enough, but do not expect lavish accommodations- they have a small, simple courtyard with a hot tub where basic cheeses and bottles of wine are set out every afternoon- a nice touch but by no means extravagant. The continental breakfast is simple but that's to be expected with continental breakfasts. It was perfect to kickstart our day! Also be aware that parking is not included in the price for the hotel- it is available in a public garage across the street (literally like 10 steps from the Inn entrance) and carries a cost of $20/day. In my opinion the location and price advantage make this one of the best options in Charleston. I booked the Elliot on a pair of weekdays for a quick getaway with my honey and we both thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It offered a homey environment while providing for an unbeatable location. If you're looking for lavish accommodations and want to be pampered, look elsewhere (and prepare to pay a very steep price- Charleston lodging in the downtown district is very expensive). If you're looking for a nice, quality bed-and-breakfast that will suit your lodging needs and provide awesome access to the town, the Elliot is for you. (One final note: I've heard some complain that the Elliot doesn't provide enough luxury for it high price tag. While it's true that the Inn carries a high price compared to most hotels nationally, Charleston lodging in this area is very expensive. The well-kept, clean environment coupled with amazing location definitely warrant the higher rates). My lovebug and I thoroughly enjoyed our time in Charleston and owe much of that to the staff at "E-House", as a much wittier reviewer coined the Inn in a previous post.
reviews.title: Great location, way overpriced, less than mediocre room, unfriendly staff.
Could have been better
reviews.text: Beautiful courtyard, flower boxes. Small pool. Property in an excellent location but sandwiched between two restaurants. It gives off a nice New Orleanesque vibe. The downside is that the view out of our window was of the kitchen door of a restaurant next door. A dehumidifier running in the room and two layers of window ensured that noise was not a issue at all. It's just that there was constant traffic morning noon and night so there was no privacy with the shades open. I also hate to report that I stepped on a cockroach in the room. Overall I don't feel like the experience matched the price we paid and I'd certainly stay somewhere else next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from stay at Elliott House. I thought it was wonderful. Room was comfortable and breakfast in the courtyard quite romantic. Staff couldn't be nicer. Great location, staff was very knowledgeable of the area and things to do. Some rain there, but the staff had options for us to see. Next day, we took the bikes provided by the hotel to see Charleston the easy way. Walking distance to good restaurantsk. Very pleased with the whole trip.
reviews.title: stay at Elliott House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our stay. Nice rooms some with outdoor patio off rooms.beautiful court yard .Wine and cheese in the afternoon. Easy paid parking across the street. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. We will stay there next visit to Charleston. Easy walking to all the shopping and restaurants.
reviews.title: Old world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is probably the most "mixed" my feelings have been about a hotel after a recent stay. There are a lot of great things going for this property, but some negatives as well. First, the good:
reviews.title: Mixed feelings about this inn

reviews.text: -Great location. Truly in the heart of downtown - walk to everything. Between three excellent restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel in an excellent location. When you go to Charleston you want to stay in a local Inn - and this is THE place to do it. You couldn't ask for a better location - everything is walking distance. The rooms had so much character, the courtyard was beyond beautiful & the service was top notch. The staff was very knowledgeable & really helped us with designing our trip. When I go back to Charleston, I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Stay in Charleston

reviews.text: I stayed in Room 10. The room had minimal space to accommodate luggage. I only had 2 small bags. The room also smelled strongly of Raid Bug Spray. The worst though was the noise. Room 10 is right by the street and Husk Restaurant's courtyard. It was very noisy until midnight and again in the morning starting around 7AM. The bathroom was really nice. Great shower. I also liked the pretty Charleston style courtyard with the large hot tub. I used one of the inn's bikes and that was nice. However, I was warned when I checked in that they had a very limited number of bikes and they may not be available. I thought the Elliott House was overpriced for what I got. During my next stay, I want to try out the Vendue Inn which is nearby.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay again

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and individually designed - our friends' room was different from ours. The beds were SO comfy. I had a bit of noise from the restaurant next door after they closed - the staff cleaning up, but it didn't last long. Breakfast was adequate, with three choices. It would have been nice to have a little more than a bagel and half a grapefruit. Location was perfect - in walking distance of whatever we needed. Would definitely stay again and would thoroughly recommend this to anyone.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Elliott House Inn is in a great location for your walking tour of the Charleston historic district. It's location makes me give it 4 stars instead of 3. We stayed in room 33. The room was medium size and has hardwood floors. Nice furniture including a 4 poster bed and armoire. There was one window looking at the wall of the restaurant next door. The bathroom was large enough and had a walk in shower with hot water that takes a minute to arrive. There was quite a bit of noise at night from the restaurant next door. There were enough electric outlets for my gadgets. The Internet WiFi signal was sometimes good, sometimes not so good. The included breakfast was delivered to our room each morning. It was very skimpy compared to what we are used to getting at other hotels. Don't plan on filling up on the hotel breakfast and then just having a light snack for lunch. They also put out a couple of bottles of wine, and a tray of cheese and crackers in the evening. Again, I would call it skimpy. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great location, skimpy breakfast

reviews.text: Charleston is one of my favorite cities, and very easy to navigate on foot. The Elliott House Inn is perfectly located - close to King Street and Meeting Street, and in the middle of its own 'restaurant row'. If you've over done it during the day, you can go next door to the excellent 82 Queen or turn left and choose from either Husk or Poogan's Porch, two great restaurants.
reviews.title: Location and charm

reviews.text: The review from earlier is correct about the shower water pressure. It has two heads but my husband and I could barely get them to spray more than a light shower...I like heavy water pressure in my hotel rooms so this was big for me. Our room also had a musty smell but I attribute that to it being an old building. Staff was friendly and helped guide us around town to great shops and dining places. I just expected more for the price but I guess you pay for the prime location with this hotel...although there are many other options on the same block. Overall no major complaints but I have to be honest I won't go back or recommend it to my traveling friends.
reviews.title: Great Location, average rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location for exploring Charleston on foot. The parking garage across the street will get very expensive if you take your car in and out of the garage to explore the surrounding areas. The hotel staff are very knowledgable about the history and give great advice for seeing this wonderful city. And as you would expect from Charleston, the staff are very hospitable, Southern charm bountiful. The room was rather small, but well decorated. A small breakfast daily in the courtyard was a wonderful way to begin the day.
reviews.title: Quaint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the quaint room and beautiful furnishings. The staff was very helpful and we loved being right in the middle of the historic district. There is a parking garage across the street and we never need to move the car again after we got to the hotel. They deliver a delicious, continental breakfast to either your room or the courtyard every morning.
reviews.title: Adorable Property in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only problem was a new mattress was delivered to our room during our stay and we were not told that this might happen. We may have secured some of our belongings or just appreciated being advised of this. We requested no housekeeping that day and did not expect anyone to be in the room.
reviews.title: Best Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a great package that includes a gift certificate and reservation for the fabulous restaurant, Husk, which is right next door. Terrific idea.
reviews.title: Give this place a miss

description: Restored to perfection and centrally located in the heart of Charleston's fascinating historic district, The Elliott House Inn's 25 rooms decorated in Eighteenth Century reproductions, offer historic period charm and contemporary comforts all within walking distance to the famous market area, art galleries, boutique and antique shopping and world renowned dining. The Elliott House Inn surrounds you with the ambiance of a time gone by while providing the comforts and amenities of the present.
